Detailed Description

Header file for Mouse.c.

Define Documentation

#define HID_IDLE_CHANGESONLY   0

Idle period indicating that reports should be sent only when the inputs have changed

#define LEDMASK_USB_ENUMERATING   (LEDS_LED2 | LEDS_LED3)

LED mask for the library LED driver, to indicate that the USB interface is enumerating.

#define LEDMASK_USB_ERROR   (LEDS_LED1 | LEDS_LED3)

LED mask for the library LED driver, to indicate that an error has occurred in the USB interface.

#define LEDMASK_USB_NOTREADY   LEDS_LED1

LED mask for the library LED driver, to indicate that the USB interface is not ready.

#define LEDMASK_USB_READY   (LEDS_LED2 | LEDS_LED4)

LED mask for the library LED driver, to indicate that the USB interface is ready.

#define REQ_GetIdle   0x02

HID Class specific request to get the idle timeout period of the device.

#define REQ_GetProtocol   0x03

HID Class specific request to get the current HID protocol in use, either report or boot.

#define REQ_GetReport   0x01

HID Class specific request to get the next HID report from the device.

#define REQ_SetIdle   0x0A

HID Class specific request to set the idle timeout period of the device.

#define REQ_SetProtocol   0x0B

HID Class specific request to set the current HID protocol in use, either report or boot.

#define REQ_SetReport   0x09

HID Class specific request to send the next HID report to the device.

Function Documentation

void CreateMouseReport ( USB_MouseReport_Data_t *  ReportData  ) 

Fills the given HID report data structure with the next HID report to send to the host.

Parameters:
[out] ReportData Pointer to a HID report data structure to be filled
void EVENT_USB_Device_ConfigurationChanged ( void   ) 

Event handler for the USB_ConfigurationChanged event. This is fired when the host sets the current configuration of the USB device after enumeration - the device endpoints are configured and the mouse reporting task started.

void EVENT_USB_Device_Connect ( void   ) 

Event handler for the USB_Connect event. This indicates that the device is enumerating via the status LEDs and starts the library USB task to begin the enumeration and USB management process.

void EVENT_USB_Device_Disconnect ( void   ) 

Event handler for the USB_Disconnect event. This indicates that the device is no longer connected to a host via the status LEDs and stops the USB management and Mouse reporting tasks.

void EVENT_USB_Device_StartOfFrame ( void   ) 

Event handler for the USB device Start Of Frame event.

void EVENT_USB_Device_UnhandledControlRequest ( void   ) 

Event handler for the USB_UnhandledControlRequest event. This is used to catch standard and class specific control requests that are not handled internally by the USB library (including the HID commands, which are all issued via the control endpoint), so that they can be handled appropriately for the application.

void Mouse_Task ( void   ) 

Task to manage HID report generation and transmission to the host, when in report mode.

void SetupHardware ( void   ) 

Configures the board hardware and chip peripherals for the demo's functionality.
